ygData.subject: RE: Adventure vacation in Kithicor
ygData.msgSnippet: I happened to run across the Wolves in Kithicor last night.  They viewed me as Amiable, I am a follower of Tunare. And as a general rule I try to avoid killing
ygData.messageBody:
I happened to run across the Wolves in Kithicor last night. They viewed me
as Amiable, I am a follower of Tunare. And as a general rule I try to avoid
killing things that are amiable to me :)

Also on the merchant pricing it seems merchants that get a lot of business
seem to pay less for items.

Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
Master Brewer of Societus Argenti
Amerginn - Test server

>From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Adventure vacation in Kithicor
>Date: Tue, 13 Jul 1999 10:10:51 -0600
>
>From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
>
> > die kind of feeling, but more of a prickling along the back of your neck
>you
> > get when your 'Wolf' faction takes a hit. Next thing I know it did just
> > that! Since when is there a faction of Wolves? Unnerved I walked
>around
>
> >I think ever since they fixed it so wolves and bears no longer
> >attack druids and rangers on sight. I would dearly love to
> >know how to raise my faction with wolf as I've always liked
> >wolves. :-)
>
>Hmmm, doubt that. I kill wolves all of the time, and I do mean all of the
>time, trying to find those quality pelts you understand so I can clothe
>myself in studded and some day reinforced armor. I even died yesterday
>when
>4 silvermist wolves decided I was being mean to their fellow in N Karana
>and
>joined in. I have never seen a hit to 'Wolf' faction before and they all
>still glare threateningly at me like they did the day I was born.
>
>Kitasi the wolf-hated?
>
